section.heading: 724.1. Temporary guardianship; designated successor guardian; construction

content.p: An individual who has been named as a successor guardian in the guardianship subsidy agreement may request an ex parte order of temporary guardianship of the child in a motion for guardianship or modification of guardianship pursuant to Article 720 or 724.
An ex parte order of temporary guardianship of the child may be granted to the named successor only if all of the following conditions are satisfied:
The current guardian is incapacitated or deceased.
It clearly appears from specific facts shown by a verified motion or by supporting affidavit that the individual is able to provide a stable and safe home for the child pending the hearing.
The mover was previously named as a successor guardian in a guardianship subsidy agreement with the department as shown by the agreement.

The mover certifies to the court in writing the efforts undertaken to give notice to the parent of the child, the department, and the attorney for the child of the request for the ex parte order granting temporary guardianship or the reasons supporting the claim that notice should not be required.
An ex parte order of temporary guardianship shall:
Continue until a hearing on the motion for guardianship or modification of guardianship is held and guardianship is established or denied by the court.
Provide the date on which the ex parte order is signed and the date and hour of the hearing on the motion for guardianship or modification of the guardianship.
